poem:
Debt's Long Winter

In a small library,  
Mary Ann dreams  
of cracked spines, not coins—  
student notes whisper  
past due, past hope.  
Promises melt on cold lips,  
crisp pages,  
turning,  
waiting.  
In shadows of shelves,  
her debt outlasts  
spring blooms,  
rests heavily  
on borrowed futures.
